meanings.definition: To lift or haul with great effort
meanings.sent1: The workers were heaving the heavy boxes onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: She heaved the sack of potatoes onto her shoulder.
meanings.sent3: After heaving the suitcase up the stairs, she realized she forgot her keys.
meanings.sent4: He heaved the boulder aside, revealing a hidden cave entrance.
meanings.sent5: The fishermen were heaving the net out of the water, hoping for a big catch.

meanings.sent1: He heaved the ball across the field to his teammate.
meanings.sent2: The angry child heaved his toy against the wall.
meanings.sent3: She heaved the snowball at her brother, hitting him square in the back.
meanings.sent4: The storm heaved the branches around violently in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The pirate heaved the treasure chest overboard, hoping to lighten the ship.

meanings.definition: To rise and fall rhythmically, as the chest during breathing
meanings.sent1: The baby was heaving peacefully in her sleep.
meanings.sent2: His chest was heaving after running a long distance.
meanings.sent3: The old engine was heaving and sputtering before finally starting.
meanings.sent4: The waves were heaving gently against the shore in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: She could see his chest heaving with each breath as he slept soundly.

meanings.definition: To feel strong emotions, such as nausea or disgust
meanings.sent1: She was heaving with disgust at the sight of the rotten food.
meanings.sent2: The smell of the garbage had her heaving uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: He was heaving with nausea after the roller coaster ride.
meanings.sent4: The gruesome scene in the movie had the audience heaving in horror.
meanings.sent5: The foul odor had everyone heaving and covering their noses.
